subject: Olympic Games
lead_paragraph: Olympic leaders voted yesterday to create a Youth Olympics meant to lure children from computer screens and onto the playing fields. The first such event is planned for 2010 for 3,200 athletes, ages 14-18. It would be the first major global sports festival created by the International Olympic Committee since the advent of the Winter Games in 1924. All Olympic sports would be represented, but with fewer events. Details must be worked out, but the first Youth Olympics would be a summer games, and the site will be chosen in February.
